data.title: Yummy pizza!
data.text: We had a great pizza and beer lunch here after moving. They have a bunch of different pizza combinations that I cannot wait to try. Also, great service.

data.title: Great pizza.
data.text: Can't decide which gourmet pizza to get?  They will do a half and half.  Brisk takeout business, but that didn't seem to interrupt the dine in service at all.  Plenty of off street parking and easy to find downtown.

data.title: Average Pizza today; its been better previously.
data.text: Pizza was slow to be delivered which meant it wasn't warm, nor was the appetizer.  Pizza in Green Bay in general is very average, especially the delivery.  Take my word for it, this is a subway sandwich town not a pizza town.

data.title: Terrible Delivery Service
data.text: Ordered a pizza and appetizer at 6pm for dinner. I was quoted 45min-1hour. After an hour came and passed, I called to check the status and was told it was on the next round of deliveries. When I asked how long that would be, I was told "at least 20 more minutes". Then I asked to speak to a manager and was told that the manager didn't have time. I then insisted the manager make time to speak with me. After getting the manager, they told me my food was done and sitting in the warmer and would go out on the next delivery. When I found out my food would have been at least 30+ minutes old by the time I received it, I cancelled my order. Manager's only comment was "sorry we got busy". Extremely poor delivery management. Also, when I ordered they took my phone number "in case they needed to contact me", but never thought to call and let me know they were running behind. Think twice before calling for a delivery, they have no problem sending you old food!

data.title: Excellent Pizza
data.text: They have some of the best pizza around.  Also, the extra large chocolate chip cookies are really good.  You can't go wrong with a pizza from here.

data.title: More than expected
data.text: From the moment I walked into the Glass Nickel, I saw this was more than just a pizza place. Sporting a full bar and well kept dining area, this restaurant was not only larger than I had figured from the exterior, but also much in much better condition than I have come to expect in Green Bay, and it's kept looking nice by a dedicated staff of truly wonderful individuals. Great food here too!  All around A+

data.title: We always order Glass Nickel when staying in Green Bay or Appleton.
data.text: We ordered delivery to our motel room on a Saturday evening. We were told an hour wait. No problem, we understand. Quite a while later I received a call on my cell from the delivery driver stating that he went to our room but was told by a man they did not order pizza. Come to find out the guy who took our order wrote down the wrong motel. No problem he came over right away. While the poor driver felt bad we were ok with it and completely understand.  I've worked in food service and with the public and so I understand. Things happen. The pizza was hot and as delicious as ever. The driver was very friendly and we will definitely be ordering again when we are in town the next time.

data.title: I hated how GOOD it was!
data.text: This place caught me off guard as to how good the pizza was. I highly suggest you try this place. Plenty of options and some unique combinations. The ”cardiac arrest” pizza was so good I hated myself for eating sooo much of it. Nice selection of beers as well. I will be back!

data.title: Very Good
data.text: A pet friendly outdoor seating area was why I went here.  The staff here are very friendly and answer any questions.  The beer selection is outstanding and the food is very good.

data.title: An hour and 20 minutes on a random Wednesday night?!
data.text: We ordered out from here on a Wednesday night at 9:10 pm, while staying at the Tundra Lodge. I believe we were quoted approximately 50 minutes for delivery. In actuality, it was 80 minutes. Really?! On a non-Packer season, random Wednesday night? Totally unacceptable. The pizza was good, but nothing is worth waiting 80 minutes for.

data.title: Trivia + Pizza = Fun!
data.text: I love going to glass nickel on Mondays. They have trivia and $5 pan pizzas. I always get the pan crust but you can get thin too. There are a lot of topping choices too! You can't go wrong but the BBQ chicken is my favorite.

data.title: Excellent Pizza
data.text: I had their olympian pizza with bread sticks - it was really good. The crust was crisp but fluffy. They had 12, 14 and 16 inch pizza options. The dinning atmosphere was casual and it looked like they had outdoor seating options as well.

data.title: Best Pizza in GB
data.text: I am not crazy about their flavors (I just want pizza flavored pizza) but if you build your own, you get an absolutely wonderful pizza.

data.title: Great pizza, disappointing fish
data.text: We have enjoyed their pizza on other occasions so we decided to give them a try at delivering a Friday fish fry.  The shrimp was OK and the fries were good but the batter on the fish filet was undercooked and soggy.  We ordared cheesy tater tots but we got a side order of more fries.  Not what we ordered and not worth what we paid for them.  The cocktail sauce and Remoulade ($1.50 extra for a small cup) were disappointing.  Stick with the pizza.  The rest is out of their comfort zone.  They missed the mark on three important things that should be very basic and easy to get right.

data.title: Great Pizza and Service
data.text: We took a chance on this downtown restaurant. We were just driving by looking for a casual place for dinner. The staff was very attentive. Actually let me sample the cider when I couldn't make up my mind. We split a salad and had a 14 inch hand tossed pizza. Both were delicious!  Local bar/restaurant crowd. Casual and comfortable. Definitely in our go to list when in Green Bay!

data.title: Delicious pizza
data.text: We had their Chicky Chicky Parm Parm pizza.  It was splended. They have a wide variety of craft beers, creative mixed drinks and artisan pizzas. Good prices and waitstaff.

data.title: Fast and Hot deliveries for office lunches!
data.text: We order in our office from Glass Nickel as least twice a month.  Their daily lunch specials can't be beat.  We order pizzas for a crowd and they never disappoint!

data.title: Pizza
data.text: This was recommended to us by the hotel staff and we were looking for something that wasn't a chain. Can't miss with the Glass Nickel. We had the special (which was buy a specialty pizza for $18). From the wait staff to the food we highly recommend this pizza place that also serves a lot of different menu items.

data.title: Okay food, loud atmosphere
data.text: The pizza that we got tasted good but wasn't anything special. They also had trivia night going on in which there were some obnoxiously drunk and loud customers shouting in the booths around us. It was a definite turn off to the surroundings.

data.title: Great first experience
data.text: My husband and I came here on a romantic late night whim and tried anchovies pizza for the first time and fell in love. It was greasy, salty, and paired perfectly with the cheap mixed drinks and fancy microbrews they served. It was very quiet, so much so we thought it was closed when we first walked up. But we went in toward the back and were served promptly. We are looking forward to having that anchovie pizza again. And I do not usually love pizza, let alone crave it!
